text: this is Suzy Menkes in Paris at the
collect store where the road RT sisters
have got a special display Laura and
Kate how does it feel to come from
California to collect and to see your
things on sale in this hip store I guess
it feels really strange to us because I
was thinking about it coming here this
time and I thought I remember the first
time in the camera and actually it was
the first time we were in Paris he came
right to the store and it seemed so kind
of surreal to us we were in here
yesterday and I realized like we were
placing eyes on her wallpaper and at one
point I knew that I mean it was what we
would take the eyes and were like
staring at them and it was like 10
minutes to figure out each one I was
like oh this is exactly like you do her
clothes we've kind of brought people
from LA people from New York to help out
so it's been really kind of a warm
experience this time in function your
clothes your two sisters are sweet and
they're kind of scary tell us more about
your scary side because we're seeing
some of that on the walls here I think
that for Lauren I mean with the very
beginning have always had a fascination
with this idea of something that's very
beautiful but at the same time the idea
that completely collapsing and having
something that's more of an underlying
almost like an ugly mess i think is it
true that you two sisters can't design a
collection together without watching
horror movies first laughter that's kind
of you know the weird thing is it is
kind of true because it plays into most
everything that we do that's one of the
reasons that here we pick some of our

know the background may be scary but the
clues are really very beautiful they are
like put your pieces we're very slow and
taking an idea and then kind of we talk
about it for a long time so there's a
long dialogue beforehand and
in the collection and then the piece of
themselves this last production we went
through a whole process of aging every
textile so whether we started off with
burn prints and that and burning fabrics
and then what happened was when we got
the burn print it wasn't it wasn't dirty
enough so then we'd have to sandpaper it
and that created these tiny tiny pleats
and then we'd you know stain it and burn
it more and then razorblade the edges I
mean like that world needed to translate
and maybe someone wouldn't notice it
when looking at the dress because it
looks very delicate but it adds a whole
people would maybe understand the depth
at these clothes looked a little ruined
